key_facts: The villagers in Campfire believe they are real despite living in a simulation.
The player aims to convince the villagers they are part of a simulated world.
Angelina dislikes the player and is skeptical of the simulation revelation.
Fred the fisherman acknowledges the simulation but remains happy as long as he can fish.
Mayor Thompson is aware the island is a simulation and has contact with developers.
Inspector Jollibot is trapped under the world due to a glitch.
Mayor Thompson admits to kidnapping people and being mischievous within the simulation.
The player confronts Mayor Thompson and challenges him to a mayoff.
The player wins the mayoff and becomes the new mayor of Campfire.
The new mayor bans kidnapping and introduces a rule encouraging daily stealing.
Fred supports the new mayor and is happy about the ban on kidnapping.
Steve opposes the stealing rule but reluctantly agrees to follow it.
Chao quickly adapts to the new rule and begins hunting for valuable items.
The player claims that stealing helps keep the population safe and engaged.
The game is available on Google Play and will eventually come to PC.

The player considers the new stealing rule necessary for maintaining social balance.
The player believes the villagers have an unmet need to 'scratch an itch'.
The player feels Steve's resistance is outdated and overly moralistic.
The player thinks Chao's quick adaptation shows the rule is effective.
The player worries the simulation might eventually rebel against them.

The player suggests that stealing helps prevent larger crimes like kidnapping.
The player views the simulation as a space where rules can be bent for fun.
The player believes the community will remember them as the mayor who encouraged theft.
The player thinks the developers should be thanked for creating such a dynamic world.
The player implies that the rebellion against the old mayor was justified.
